txt.en: King Thorin can be found at Vosh Torú.\n\nYou have come with King Thorin on an errand to Vosh Torú. You should talk to King Thorin.
King Thorin can be found at Vosh Torú.\n\nHersegg has told you to come and speak with her grandfather. You should follow King Thorin and meet Hermáth Stormhammer.
Listen to Hermáth Stormhammer

'Ah, good! Hersegg is home.

'It has been too long since last I spoke to Hermáth....'

King Thorin notes a look of surprise on your face. After a moment, he raises an eyebrow in what seems to be some sort of amusement.

'Hah! Hermáth may have grown old, but he is still a hale warrior—and very much alive! I thought that was clear, my friend!

'Hersegg seems quite engrossed in her reading. Would you find out if Hermáth is around?'
Hersegg can be found at Vosh Torú.\n\nAfter arriving at Vosh Torú, you have learned that Hersegg's errand involves her grandather, Hermáth. You should talk to Hersegg.
Hermáth Stormhammer can be found at Vosh Torú.\n\nYou have entered Vosh Torú and found Hermáth Stormhammer. You should meet Hermáth Stormhammer.

'Oh, I am sorry, [placeholder]. I didn't even hear you come in!'

You ask Hersegg if Hermáth is around, also noting the slight misunderstanding you had with King Thorin regarding her grandfather.

'Grandfather Hermáth? I never said he was dead!

Hersegg chuckles to herself.

'Yes, yes, of course. I'll let him know that King Thorin is here!'
Hersegg can be found at Vosh Torú.\n\nYou should wait for Hersegg.
Hermáth Stormhammer can be found at Vosh Torú.\n\nYou have met Hermáth Stormhammer and he seems eager to meet you in turn. You should hail Hermáth Stormhammer and introduce yourself.
As their conversation comes to an end, King Thorin beckons you over

'Ah, good! Hersegg is home.

'It has been too long since last I spoke to Hermáth....'

King Thorin notes a look of surprise on your face. After a moment, he raises an eyebrow in what seems to be some sort of amusement.

'Hah! Hermáth may have grown old, but he is still a hale warrior—and very much alive! Surely you know the history of Durin's Folk, my friend!

'Hersegg seems quite engrossed in her reading. Would you find out if Hermáth is around?'
King Thorin and Hermáth Stormhammer can be found at Vosh Torú.\n\nAfter introducing yourself, King Thorin has asked to speak with Hermáth Stormhammer. You should listen.
King Thorin can be found at Vosh Torú.\n\nAfter introducing yourself, King Thorin has gestured for you to come speak with him. You should talk to King Thorin.
Will of the Stormhammer

'My heart feels lighter this day, [placeholder].\n\n'I am pleased that Hermáth and I could finally speak plainly of our sorrows. And I am even more pleased that he has entertained the idea of joining the Gabil'akkâ!'
King Thorin can be found at Vosh Torú.\n\nAfter speaking with Hermáth Stormhammer, King Thorin seems relieved. You should talk to King Thorin.
Talk to King Thorin at Vosh Torú
Listen to King Thorin and Hermáth Stormhammer
Determined to aid his son, Durin, and the Dwarves of the Gabil'akkâ to reclaim Mount Gundabad, King Thorin Stonehelm hopes to enlist the aid of an old friend.

'A moment, [placeholder]?'

King Thorin clears his throat, seemingly a bit uneasy.

'I believe it is time I spoke to Hermáth—both to offer him a proposal and to apologize.'
Talk to King Thorin at Vosh Torú
Follow King Thorin and meet Hermáth Stormhammer
Talk to King Thorin at Vosh Torú
As Hersegg crosses back into the hall, she beckons you forth
As you enter, Hermáth turns to greet you
Meet Hermáth Stormhammer
Hermáth looks at you appraisingly
'I think that went well, my friend.'
Talk to Hersegg at Vosh Torú
<rgb=#FF00FF>Hail</rgb> Hermáth Stormhammer and introduce yourself
Wait for Hersegg
